page.title: 17CARDROSS _ LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: {KILMAHEW CHAPEL -}SOMETIMES KNOWN AS KIRKTON OR ST. MAHEW'S, IT CAN BE TRACED BACK TO THE FIFTH CENTURY. AT ONE TIME, IT WAS A PROTESTANT "CHAPEL OF EASE" AND, AT ANOTHER, A PAROCHIAL SCHOOL. AFTER FALLING INTO DECAY, IT WAS RE-BUILT AND RE-OPENED AS THE PLACE OF WORSHIP FOR LOCAL ROMAN CATHOLICS IN 1955. {KILMAHEW CASTLE -}THIS WAS THE HOME OF THE NAPIER FAMILY FOR 6OO YEARS UNTIL THE EARLY NINETEENTH CENTURY. NOW A RUIN, THE REMAINS OF A WELL, CHIMNEY AND TURNPIKE STAIRS CAN BE SEEN. {THE DOVECOT -}THIS FINE EXAMPLE STANDS IN THE GROUNDS OF THE DERELICT DARLEITH HOUSE. NEARBY ARE THE RUINS OF A PRIVATE CHAPEL.
